lead_paragraph: The No. 7 that Paul Newman wore as Reg Dunlop in “Slap Shot” is going to the rafters of the Syracuse War Memorial arena, where part of the movie was filmed. Newman died last month at 83. The Syracuse Crunch announced that the team would pay tribute to Newman by raising a banner before Saturday’s A.H.L. game against the Rochester Americans. The banner will remain for the entire season. A video tribute to Newman’s role in ”Slap Shot” will be shown during the ceremony. Part of the movie was filmed in the arena in 1977.
